intro: Psychotria evansensis, commonly known as the "Evans' Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Brazil and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Psychotria evansensis is also known for containing psychoactive alkaloids, which have been of interest in ethnobotanical and pharmacological research.
